item.title: Senior Producer - iPhone/iTouch Games (san jose north)
item.description:
The entertainment and games industry is growing and so is Namco Networks!  We are looking for exceptionally talented people to join our team.  Work with evolving and challenging technologies across many best-selling game titles in a fast-paced, creative and fun environment.  Join Namco Networks and play a vital role in this rapidly growing company and industry! For more information about our company, please visit: www.namcogames.com.

Senior Producer  iPhone/iTouch Games

The Senior Producer will drive all aspects of the development process, from early concept through testing. This person must own the vision for each of their titles and deliver commercially successful products.  The ideal candidate must have experience working with the Apple iPhone / iTouch platforms and needs to demonstrate creative, design, and problem-solving skills while being an effective communicator.  They must be able to balance scheduling concerns with issues of quality, working cooperatively with design, engineering, art, and audio to create the best possible product on time and on budget.  The Senior Producer will be responsible for tracking and coordinating the teams projects and reporting progress to management.  This person must possess leadership skills and have the ability to communicate and present information effectively and persuasively. Finally, the candidate must also have a solid understanding of production techniques and milestones. 

Responsibilities

·         Drive internal and external teams to ship games which are on time and on budget

·         Ensure that milestones are met and properly delivered, while looking out for the project as a whole

·         Work with producers to establish and maintain each games vision, feature set, scope, staffing plan, schedule, and budget

·         Mentor staff producers depending on needs in regards to communication, processes, and progress.

·         Monitor absences, time-off, and conduct of staff producers.

·         Oversee work relationships with producers, handle performance reviews and participate in interviews and selection of candidates.

·         Manage the day-to-day production issues, preemptively addressing issues before they impact development

·         Identify potential new developers and make recommendations to management

·         Coordinate payment of invoices for outside vendors

·         Ability to work directly with upper management to assist with business development, roadmap planning, and high level strategizing

·         Create and modify project schedules

·         Work with Marketing to develop product vision and manage and execute all aspects of the development process including design of interactive content, design documentation, schedules, budgets, production, editorial, product presentations, approvals, testing and archiving in a timely manner.

Requirements

·         Previous senior-level Producer experience with game developer/publisher required

·         5+ years of successfully shipping video games with a substantial portion of recent experience producing iPhone games

·         Must be a strategic critical thinker who is deadline oriented

·         Must be able to adapt to rapidly shifting priorities in fast-paced environment

·         Established experience in hiring and managing external production teams that have successful delivered products

·         Solid interpersonal skills to resolve production issues with internal and external resources and business units

·         Established people, presentation and organizational skills

·         Must be a strong and clear communicator  the ability to communicate with multiple teams is required, including: marketing, engineering, creative, QA, and more

·         Strong sense of ownership and urgency

·         Excellent time-management skills and instinctive prioritization

·         Familiarity with game development processes, pipelines, and production of iPhone games

·         Proven track record of delivering successful products to the marketplace

·         Ability to make use of the information given to them in order to achieve a successful outcome.

·         A passion for games

·         BA/BS or equivalent experience.

·         Ability to manage multiple projects, set priorities and meet deadlines



Professional Attributes:

·         Must be responsible and accountable; enjoys collaborating and follows through on multiple complex projects.

·         Good communicator who possesses strong written and oral communication skills.

·         Enthusiastic and outgoing, excited about working at Namco Networks and possesses a positive attitude about the potential of this company.

·         Supportive, not just within the division but also cross-functionally supportive, with a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude towards getting things done.  Does not pass the buck even if it is not within your job description.

·         Able to listen to and implement constructive criticism.

·         Well-organized and detail-oriented.

·         Demonstrates excellent analytical skills.

·         Thinks out of the box with ability to come up with creative solutions.

·         Strong team player.

Please include desired salary in cover letter.

Established January 1, 2006, Namco Networks America Inc. is a subsidiary of Namco Bandai Holdings (USA) Inc., a worldwide leader in the high-tech entertainment industry. Namco uses cutting-edge technology to provide fun, quality entertainment to mobile consumers throughout the Americas.
